text: The Bass-Morrell House is a historic mansion in Ardmore, Tennessee, U.S.. It was built in 1840 for John Bass, a landowner. It was designed in the Greek Revival architectural style. It was purchased by Jacob Morrell, the owner of the Elk River Grist Mills, in 1878. It has been listed on the National Register of Historic Places since November 10, 1988. ==References== Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Tennessee Category:Greek Revival houses in Tennessee Category:Houses completed in 1840 Category:Houses in Giles County, Tennessee
title: Bass-Morrell House
